Luca Weihs Research Scientist & Manager @ the Allen Institute for AI

I am a research scientist, manager, and lead of the AI2-THOR team at the Allen Institute for AI. My recent research interests focus on training robotic systems in simulation that seamlessly transfer to the real world. I am also broadly interested in intelligent agents that can act in complex environments, e.g. to write code or play games, especially when these agents can learn from visual interaction. I recieved my PhD in statistics from the University of Washington advised by Mathias Drton. My undergraduate years were spent at UC Berkeley where I graduated as the valedictorian in Mathematics.
